title: What is a Foreign Transaction Fee?
text:
Expert Videos 
Definition: 
Lots of business travelers travel overseas or to other countries. In the old days, they used to bring along travelers checks or even cash to exchange into local currency. These days, few business travelers do that. Instead, they simply use their credit cards . 
However, it's important to realize that when you use your credit card in other countries, you may be assessed (depending on the country and your card) a foreign transaction fee. A foreign transaction fee is a charge assessed by a credit card company for conducting a transaction in another country or in another currency. Before traveling, it's good to contact your credit card company to gain an understanding of how handle foreign transaction fees. 
It's also helpful to be aware that you might be assessed a foreign transaction fee even if you don't travel overseas--you simply need to purchase something from a merchant in another country! Related Articles
